\ntrue to release both managed and unmanaged resources; false to release only unmanaged resources.

trans-unit.source:

An integer representing the next character to be read, or -1 if no more characters are available or the reader does not support seeking.

\n
trans-unit.target:

trans-unit.source:
\n

The next character from the text reader, or -1 if no more characters are available.

trans-unit.source:
\n

When this method returns, contains the specified character array with the values between index and (index + count - 1) replaced by the characters read from the current source.

trans-unit.source: If the end of the reader is reached before the specified number of characters is read into the buffer, the method returns.
trans-unit.target: If the end of the reader is reached before the specified number of characters is read into the buffer, the method returns.

trans-unit.source:
\n

The number of characters that have been read.

trans-unit.source: The number will be less than or equal to count, depending on whether the data is available within the reader.
trans-unit.target: The number will be less than or equal to count, depending on whether the data is available within the reader.

trans-unit.source:

A task that represents the asynchronous read operation.

A task that represents the asynchronous read operation.

trans-unit.source: The value of the TResult parameter contains the total number of bytes read into the buffer.
trans-unit.target: The value of the TResult parameter contains the total number of bytes read into the buffer.

trans-unit.source:
The result value can be less than the number of bytes requested if the number of bytes currently available is less than the requested number, or it can be 0 (zero) if the end of the text has been reached.

\n
